transportAdvice: Porto has a metro system, extensive bus network, and historic trams that cover most tourist areas, making public transit a practical and affordable option. The historic centre is very walkable, though hilly terrain can be tiring; taxis and ride-hailing vehicles are widely available for longer distances or steep climbs.

weather.description: Cool and frequently rainy, with mild temperatures making heavy layers unnecessary but a waterproof jacket essential.
Still wet and cool with occasional sunny breaks, one of the rainiest months of the year.
Early spring brings slightly warmer days and a mix of rain and sunshine.
Pleasant spring weather with mild temperatures and occasional showers; a good time to visit.
Warm and mostly pleasant with decreasing rainfall and longer daylight hours.
Warm and largely dry, marking the start of the busy tourist season with comfortable conditions.
Hot and sunny with very little rain; the peak of summer and the busiest tourist period.
Similar to July, hot and dry with long sunny days and high visitor numbers.
Warm and mostly sunny with slightly cooler evenings; an excellent time to visit with fewer crowds.
Autumn brings mild temperatures and increasing rainfall, with pleasant conditions for sightseeing.
Noticeably cooler and wetter, with grey skies and frequent rain returning.
Cold and rainy with short days, though the festive atmosphere in the city centre adds seasonal charm.
